Title: Series: The Amarna Letters
Description: Clay cuneiform tablet; letter from the king of Alashiya to the king of Egypt; 29 lines; clay of which this object is made is red in colour and has several small pieces of flint in it; writing on edges and the reverse is very worn.
Curator's comments: Sampled by Allan S Gilbert in 1987. Results unpublished as at 2002.
Bibliographic references: Knudtzon, J A 1915a / Die El-Amarna Tafeln (37)
Bezold 1892a / The El-Amarna Tablets in the British Museum (7)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.173)
Sigrist M et al 2006a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, III
Condition: Fair; writing on the edges and the reverse is very worn.
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
